title: [Large-Scale] Mobile-Based Problem-Centered Heart Failure Health Education Design Project

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic medical terminology and elementary education methodologies
context.additional_context: Project where pre-service teachers design and evaluate heart failure patient education materials using mobile apps

learning_goals: Achieve the ability to convert core concepts of heart failure management into mobile problem scenarios

Learners design ≥3 educational content prototypes (audio-visual materials, interactive modules, etc.) applying Mayer’s multimedia learning theory and cognitive load theory, and submit deliverables meeting ≥4 of 5 evaluation criteria (clarity, cognitive load management, interactivity, etc.) from peer reviews and expert evaluations.
Acquire the ability to perform iterative app prototype improvement processes incorporating learner feedback
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
